title: Ssense's Annual Sale Is My Super Bowl—43 Items I Won't Fumble Buying
text: Level with me for a minute. What brings you the most joy around this time of the year? Do you relish drinking a cup of hot chocolate? Live for spending time with loved ones? Or perhaps you love traveling to new places? Whatever comes to mind for you, there's no denying there's so much to look forward to during this time of the year. But if we're being honest, it doesn't get much better for fashion people than the start of game-time (and no, I'm not talking about football season). For us, the beginning of the holiday sale season is as exhilarating as any sport, especially when discussing one specific event: Ssense's annual sale.Now, I'm not delusional enough to think I could ever compete in any athletic competition. But could I commit to combing through hundreds of pages of markdowns? Probably not. I've come to believe that the junior leagues of shopping can be considered the Black Friday and Cyber Monday held by various other retailers. But the Super Bowl? Well, that's all Ssense, baby. Frankly, I know I'm not alone in that sentiment. I can't scroll through social media without hearing about this sale (for a good reason). They offer a chic curation of rising labels and designer brands in the womenswear, menswear, and home categories that are unmatched. If that weren't enough, its annual sale offers up to 60% off.You don't want to play when it comes to this holiday sale. But if you're not the type of person with the time or "athletic" training to shift through hundreds of pages in search of the best sale finds, don't fret. Ahead, I've rounded up the 43 best fashion finds from Ssense's sale right now. Whether you're looking for a gift idea for the most stylish person in your life or want a more well-rounded wardrobe in 2025, these finds will surely bring you joy this season. Prada Eyewear Black Prada Symbole Sunglasses Two words: Prada sunglasses. KHAITE Blue The Ross Denim Jacket You can't go wrong with investing in Khaite's denim. LISA YANG Black Aletta Sweater Cue "Sweater Weather" by The Neighbourhood. Aesther Ekme Black Demi Lune Bag Give your commuter tote a chic upgrade. Levi's Levi's Blue Ankle Column Denim Midi Skirt Denim maxi skirts are so back. Jil Sander Black High Tall Boots These boots are made for walkin'. Alighieri Silver The Abundant Dream Hoop Earrings These hammered hoops give a whole new meaning to the term "wearable art." Silk Laundry Gray 90s Slip Dress Slip dresses are a year-round staple. Le Monde Beryl Black Luna Ballerina Flats Once springtime rolls around, you'll be so happy you bought these mesh flats while they were on sale. Blumarine Black Halter Neck Tank Top Nothing Written Off-White Classic Mini Golf Bag LE17SEPTEMBRE Black Belted Maxi Skirt You can wear this pencil skirt from the office to date night. BY FAR Black Selene Mules Gucci Burgundy Geometric Sunglasses These Gucci glasses perfect gift for anyone on your list (even yourself). The Garment Off-White Conrad Coat Scandi brands always understand the assignment. Beaufille Brown Innes Vest JACQUEMUS Brown La Casa Le Petit Calino Bag The way I had to hold back a scream when I spotted this snakeskin clutch bag… LEMAIRE Brown Asymmetrical Wrapover Midi Skirt The perfect addition to your work wardrobe. Ganni Brown Feminine Buckle Ballerina Flats Honestly surprised these aren't sold out yet. Simone Rocha Off-White Nano Pearl Egg Bag If you've been looking for an excuse to buy this Simone Rocha bag for years, consider this your permission slip. SHUSHU/TONG Black Slim-Fit Minidress KIMHĒKIM Black Pearl Tear Round Sunglasses Sunglasses that are so good that they're worth shedding a tear over. Sandy Liang SSENSE Exclusive Black MJ Double Strap Ballerina Flats Aspiring ballerinas, apply here. Staud Black Maude Bowler Bag Not the season's hottest Staud bag currently being on sale… Ssense, you never disappoint! Our Legacy Gray Whale Coat The cost per wear you'll get out of this gray coat will basically pay for itself. LESET Black Lauren Turtleneck Turtlenecks are the perfect base layer for wintertime. rag & bone Black Shea Relaxed Straight Jeans These black jeans are bound to become a staple in your closet. Jimmy Choo Black Maryanne Sb 65 Heels Slingbacks are the backbone of every stylish wardrobe. Nanushka Khaki Alora Down Vegan Leather Jacket It doesn't get more decadent than a vegan leather down jacket. The Frankie Shop Black Gelso Oversized Blazer The perfect little black blazer. Break up your all-black outfits with this bright-red mini bag. HommeGirls White Classic Shirt Finally, you can stop stealing their button-down shirt! Loulou Studio Gray Sbiru Trousers Wool trousers will always be a great investment for winter. Miista Black Brenda Boots You'll wear these ankle boots all the time. Axel Arigato Taupe Dew Scarf Detailed Jacket Cozy season embodied in a single coat. Carhartt Work In Progress Off-White Ethel Shirt Marge Sherwood Brown Large Bag Allow us to introduce you to your new favorite shoulder bag. FRAME Blue Low Slung Barrel Jeans With barrel-leg denim still trending, this sale find is a must-buy. Wales Bonner x Adidas Edition Samba Millennium Sneakers Calling all sneakerheads! Puppets and Puppets Black Spoon Bag Not a crumb left in sight. Coperni Black Lace Slip Midi Dress Now here's a dress you'll want to wear long past holiday party season. The Attico Silver Bes Mules Stand Studio Black Maria Faux-Fur Coat Ball out within your budget. Jasmine Fox-Suliaman is a fashion editor living in New York City. What began as a hobby (blogging on Tumblr) transformed into a career dedicated to storytelling through various forms of digital media. She started her career at the print publication 303 Magazine, where she wrote stories, helped produce photo shoots, and planned Denver Fashion Week. After moving to Los Angeles, she worked as MyDomaine's social media editor until she was promoted to work across all of Clique's publications (MyDomaine, Byrdie, and Who What Wear) as the community manager. Over the past few years, Jasmine has worked on Who What Wear's editorial team, using her extensive background to champion rising BIPOC designers, weigh in on viral trends, and profile stars such as Janet Mock and Victoria Monét. She is especially interested in exploring how art, fashion, and pop culture intersect online and IRL.
html:
Level with me for a minute. What brings you the most joy around this time of the year? Do you relish drinking a cup of hot chocolate? Live for spending time with loved ones? Or perhaps you love traveling to new places? Whatever comes to mind for you, there's no denying there's so much to look forward to during this time of the year. But if we're being honest, it doesn't get much better for fashion people than the start of game-time (and no, I'm not talking about football season). For us, the beginning of the holiday sale season is as exhilarating as any sport, especially when discussing one specific event: Ssense's annual sale.

Now, I'm not delusional enough to think I could ever compete in any athletic competition. But could I commit to combing through hundreds of pages of markdowns? Probably not. I've come to believe that the junior leagues of shopping can be considered the Black Friday and Cyber Monday held by various other retailers. But the Super Bowl? Well, that's all Ssense, baby. Frankly, I know I'm not alone in that sentiment. I can't scroll through social media without hearing about this sale (for a good reason). They offer a chic curation of rising labels and designer brands in the womenswear, menswear, and home categories that are unmatched. If that weren't enough, its annual sale offers up to 60% off.

You don't want to play when it comes to this holiday sale. But if you're not the type of person with the time or "athletic" training to shift through hundreds of pages in search of the best sale finds, don't fret. Ahead, I've rounded up the 43 best fashion finds from Ssense's sale right now. Whether you're looking for a gift idea for the most stylish person in your life or want a more well-rounded wardrobe in 2025, these finds will surely bring you joy this season.

Prada Eyewear

Black Prada Symbole Sunglasses

Two words: Prada sunglasses.

KHAITE

Blue The Ross Denim Jacket

You can't go wrong with investing in Khaite's denim.

LISA YANG

Black Aletta Sweater

Cue "Sweater Weather" by The Neighbourhood.

Aesther Ekme

Black Demi Lune Bag

Give your commuter tote a chic upgrade.

Levi's

Levi's Blue Ankle Column Denim Midi Skirt

Denim maxi skirts are so back.

Jil Sander

Black High Tall Boots

These boots are made for walkin'.

Alighieri

Silver The Abundant Dream Hoop Earrings

These hammered hoops give a whole new meaning to the term "wearable art."

Silk Laundry

Gray 90s Slip Dress

Slip dresses are a year-round staple.

Le Monde Beryl

Black Luna Ballerina Flats

Once springtime rolls around, you'll be so happy you bought these mesh flats while they were on sale.

Blumarine

Black Halter Neck Tank Top

Nothing Written

Off-White Classic Mini Golf Bag

LE17SEPTEMBRE

Black Belted Maxi Skirt

You can wear this pencil skirt from the office to date night.

BY FAR

Black Selene Mules

Gucci

Burgundy Geometric Sunglasses

These Gucci glasses perfect gift for anyone on your list (even yourself).

The Garment

Off-White Conrad Coat

Scandi brands always understand the assignment.

Beaufille

Brown Innes Vest

JACQUEMUS

Brown La Casa Le Petit Calino Bag

The way I had to hold back a scream when I spotted this snakeskin clutch bag…

LEMAIRE

Brown Asymmetrical Wrapover Midi Skirt

The perfect addition to your work wardrobe.

Ganni

Brown Feminine Buckle Ballerina Flats

Honestly surprised these aren't sold out yet.

Simone Rocha

Off-White Nano Pearl Egg Bag

If you've been looking for an excuse to buy this Simone Rocha bag for years, consider this your permission slip.

SHUSHU/TONG

Black Slim-Fit Minidress

KIMHĒKIM

Black Pearl Tear Round Sunglasses

Sunglasses that are so good that they're worth shedding a tear over.

Sandy Liang

SSENSE Exclusive Black MJ Double Strap Ballerina Flats

Aspiring ballerinas, apply here.

Staud

Black Maude Bowler Bag

Not the season's hottest Staud bag currently being on sale… Ssense, you never disappoint!

Our Legacy

Gray Whale Coat

The cost per wear you'll get out of this gray coat will basically pay for itself.

LESET

Black Lauren Turtleneck

Turtlenecks are the perfect base layer for wintertime.

rag & bone

Black Shea Relaxed Straight Jeans

These black jeans are bound to become a staple in your closet.

Jimmy Choo

Black Maryanne Sb 65 Heels

Slingbacks are the backbone of every stylish wardrobe.

Nanushka

Khaki Alora Down Vegan Leather Jacket

It doesn't get more decadent than a vegan leather down jacket.

The Frankie Shop

Black Gelso Oversized Blazer

The perfect little black blazer.

Break up your all-black outfits with this bright-red mini bag.

HommeGirls

White Classic Shirt

Finally, you can stop stealing their button-down shirt!

Loulou Studio

Gray Sbiru Trousers

Wool trousers will always be a great investment for winter.

Miista

Black Brenda Boots

You'll wear these ankle boots all the time.

Axel Arigato

Taupe Dew Scarf Detailed Jacket

Cozy season embodied in a single coat.

Carhartt Work In Progress

Off-White Ethel Shirt

Marge Sherwood

Brown Large Bag

Allow us to introduce you to your new favorite shoulder bag.

FRAME

Blue Low Slung Barrel Jeans

With barrel-leg denim still trending, this sale find is a must-buy.

Wales Bonner x Adidas

Edition Samba Millennium Sneakers

Calling all sneakerheads!

Puppets and Puppets

Black Spoon Bag

Not a crumb left in sight.

Coperni

Black Lace Slip Midi Dress

Now here's a dress you'll want to wear long past holiday party season.

The Attico

Silver Bes Mules

Stand Studio

Black Maria Faux-Fur Coat

Ball out within your budget.

Jasmine Fox-Suliaman is a fashion editor living in New York City. What began as a hobby (blogging on Tumblr) transformed into a career dedicated to storytelling through various forms of digital media. She started her career at the print publication 303 Magazine, where she wrote stories, helped produce photo shoots, and planned Denver Fashion Week. After moving to Los Angeles, she worked as MyDomaine's social media editor until she was promoted to work across all of Clique's publications (MyDomaine, Byrdie, and Who What Wear) as the community manager. Over the past few years, Jasmine has worked on Who What Wear's editorial team, using her extensive background to champion rising BIPOC designers, weigh in on viral trends, and profile stars such as Janet Mock and Victoria Monét. She is especially interested in exploring how art, fashion, and pop culture intersect online and IRL.
